alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial County West; Joshua Tree NP East; Palo Verde Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 22 at 12:02PM PST until January 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST /4 PM PST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona and southeast and southern California. * WHEN...From 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ this evening to 5 PM MST /4 PM PST/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
